Namespace: Mewdeko.Modules.OwnerOnly
Assembly: Mewdeko.dll
Syntax
[Group("config", "Commands to manage various bot things")]
public class SlashOwnerOnly.ConfigCommands : MewdekoSlashModuleBase<OwnerOnlyService>, IInteractionModuleBase

ConfigCommands(GuildSettingsService, CommandService, IServiceProvider, DiscordSocketClient, IEnumerable<IConfigService>)

Bot configuration command for setting various bot settings.

Declaration
public ConfigCommands(GuildSettingsService guildSettings, CommandService commandService, IServiceProvider services, DiscordSocketClient client, IEnumerable<IConfigService> settingServices)
Parameters
Type Name Description
GuildSettingsService guildSettings

Service for accessing and modifying guild-specific settings.
CommandService commandService

Service for bot commands
IServiceProvider services

Service provider for accessing various services.
DiscordSocketClient client

The Discord client used to interact with the Discord API.
IEnumerable<IConfigService> settingServices

Collection of services for managing bot settings.

Methods

| Edit this page View Source

AutoCommandAdd(int, string)

Adds an auto command to be executed periodically in the specified guild.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("autocommandadd", "Adds a command to run at a set interval", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task AutoCommandAdd(int interval, string cmdText)
Parameters
Type Name Description
int interval

The interval in seconds at which the command should be executed. Must be 5 seconds or more.
string cmdText

The command text to be executed automatically.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Requires the user to have Administrator permissions or to be the owner of the bot. The command will not be added if it fails any precondition checks, if it matches a forbidden command (e.g., a command to shut down the bot), or if the maximum number of auto commands (15) for the guild has been reached.

| Edit this page View Source

AutoCommandRemove(int)

Removes an auto command based on its index.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("autocommandremove", "Removes an auto command", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task AutoCommandRemove(int index)
Parameters
Type Name Description
int index

The one-based index of the auto command to remove.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Requires the user to have Administrator permissions or to be the owner of the bot. The command will decrement the index to match zero-based indexing before attempting removal. If the removal fails, an error message is sent.

| Edit this page View Source

AutoCommandsList(int)

Lists the auto commands configured for the guild.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("autocommandslist", "Lists all auto commands", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task AutoCommandsList(int page = 1)
Parameters
Type Name Description
int page

The page number of the list to display, starting from 1.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Displays a paginated list of auto commands. Each page shows up to 5 commands. Requires the user to be the owner of the bot and the command to be executed in a guild context. If there are no auto commands set, an error message is displayed.

| Edit this page View Source

Changes yml based config for the bot.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("botconfig", "Config various bot settings", false, RunMode.Default)]
public Task BotConfig(string? name = null, string? prop = null, string? value = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string name

The name of the config to change.
string prop

The property of the config to change.
string value

The new value to set for the property.
Returns

Task
| Edit this page View Source

DefPrefix(string?)

Sets or displays the default command prefix.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("defprefix", "Sets the default prefix for the bots text commands", false, RunMode.Default)]
public Task DefPrefix(string? prefix = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string prefix

The new prefix to set. If null or whitespace, the current prefix is displayed instead.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Changes the bot's command prefix for the server or displays the current prefix if no new prefix is provided. Confirmation of the new prefix or the current prefix is sent as a reply.

| Edit this page View Source

ForwardMessages()

Toggles the forwarding of direct messages to the bot's owner(s).

Declaration
[SlashCommand("forwardmessages", "Toggles whether to forward dms to the bot to owner dms", false, RunMode.Default)]
public Task ForwardMessages()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

If message forwarding is enabled, it will be disabled, and vice versa. A confirmation message is sent indicating the new state of message forwarding.

| Edit this page View Source

ForwardToAll()

Toggles whether forwarded messages are sent to all of the bot's owners or just the primary owner.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("forwardtoall", "Toggles whether to forward dms to the bot to all bot owners", false, RunMode.Default)]
public Task ForwardToAll()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

If forwarding to all owners is enabled, it will be disabled, and vice versa. A confirmation message is sent indicating the new state of this setting.

| Edit this page View Source

LanguageSetDefault(string)

Sets the default language for the bot by specifying a culture name.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("langsetdefault", "Sets the default language for the bot", false, RunMode.Default)]
public Task LanguageSetDefault(string name)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string name

The name of the culture to set as the default language. Use "default" to reset to the bot's original default language.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

This method allows changing the bot's default language or resetting it to its original default. A confirmation message will be sent upon successful change.

| Edit this page View Source

SetAvatar(string?)

Sets the bot's avatar.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("setavatar", "Sets the bots avatar", false, RunMode.Default)]
public Task SetAvatar(string? img = null)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string img

The URL of the new avatar image. If null, the command may default to removing the current avatar or doing nothing, based on implementation.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Attempts to change the bot's avatar to the image found at the specified URL. Confirmation is sent upon success.

| Edit this page View Source

SetName(string)

Changes the bot's username to the specified new name.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("setname", "Sets the bots name", false, RunMode.Default)]
public Task SetName(string newName)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string newName

The new username for the bot.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Does nothing if the new name is empty or whitespace. If a change is attempted and ratelimited, logs a warning message.

| Edit this page View Source

StartupCommandAdd(string)

Adds a new startup command to be executed when the bot starts.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("startupcommandadd", "Adds a command to run in the current channel on startup", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task StartupCommandAdd(string cmdText)
Parameters
Type Name Description
string cmdText

The text of the command to add, excluding the prefix.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Requires the user to have Administrator permissions or be the owner of the bot. Commands that could potentially restart or shut down the bot are ignored for safety reasons.

| Edit this page View Source

StartupCommandRemove(int)

Removes a startup command based on its index.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("startupcommandremove", "Removes a startup command", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
public Task StartupCommandRemove(int index)
Parameters
Type Name Description
int index

The one-based index of the startup command to remove.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Requires the user to be the owner of the bot. The command will decrement the index to match zero-based indexing before attempting removal. If the removal fails, an error message is sent; otherwise, a confirmation message is sent.

| Edit this page View Source

StartupCommandsClear()

Clears all startup commands for the guild.

Declaration
[SlashCommand("startupcommandsclear", "Clears all startup commands", false, RunMode.Default)]
[RequireContext(ContextType.Guild)]
[SlashUserPerm(GuildPermission.Administrator)]
public Task StartupCommandsClear()
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Requires the user to have Administrator permissions or to be the owner of the bot. A confirmation message is sent upon successful clearance.

Declaration

public Task StartupCommandsList(int page = 1)
Parameters
Type Name Description
int page

The page number of the list to display, starting from 1.
Returns
Type Description
Task
Remarks

Displays a paginated list of startup commands. Each page shows up to 5 commands. Requires the user to be the owner of the bot.
